properties.value:
function Disable-ieESC

{
$AdminKey = “HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Active Setup\Installed Components{A509B1A7-37EF-4b3f-8CFC-4F3A74704073}”
$UserKey = “HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Active Setup\Installed Components{A509B1A8-37EF-4b3f-8CFC-4F3A74704073}”
Set-ItemProperty -Path $AdminKey -Name “IsInstalled” -Value 0
Set-ItemProperty -Path $UserKey -Name “IsInstalled” -Value 0
Stop-Process -Name Explorer
Write-Host “IE Enhanced Security Configuration (ESC) has been disabled.” -ForegroundColor Green
}
properties.name: IES_script
activating script repo
properties.description: Link to the activating script used for importing and activate both license and configuration in activation mode

Installation and configuration of the Veeam management agent and the Veeam backup agent, depending on input parameters, on Ubuntu and Windows VM in any cloud.
Configuration of the backup policies via command line on the agent and via REST API exposed by the Veeam Service Provider Console (VSPC). 
This workflow is part of the implementation of the Backup as a Service.
The agents binay files are retrieved by a S3 bucket via http.
A license file is needed to install the agent on the VM.

input.variable_workflow_01gmgK3LkOa8JMelklBT5K: apt-get -y install dkms; apt-get -y install lvm2;
sudo dpkg -i ./veeamsnap*; sudo apt-get update; sudo dpkg -i ./veeam_*; apt-get update; apt-get -y install veeam;
veeamconfig agreement accepteula; veeamconfig agreement acceptthirdpartylicenses;

veeamconfig job create volumelevel --name $activity.definition_activity_01FD9GQE5X2SN3JcXG72nQnMPCPFHiDKBVA.output.jsonpath_queries.backup job name$ --reponame '$workflow.definition_workflow_01EBYV4LT06H73xRs5EBiYTewZkBZgDrkAS.local.variable_workflow_01FD8RKLEQJJ50Ph2Xx0P9tSjNeRjrmOVCF$' --backupallsystem

properties.description: Check the input from workload manager to see if it is a daily or montly backup
daily schedule input in workload manager, meaning that backup will happen daily

input.variable_workflow_01gmgK3LkOa8JMelklBT5K: veeamconfig schedule set --jobName $activity.definition_activity_01FD9GQE5X2SN3JcXG72nQnMPCPFHiDKBVA.output.jsonpath_queries.backup job name$ --daily --at $activity.definition_activity_01FD9GQE5X2SN3JcXG72nQnMPCPFHiDKBVA.output.jsonpath_queries.backup schedule time$

properties.description: different weekdays schedule input in workload manager, meaning that backup will happen weekly

input.variable_workflow_01gmgK3LkOa8JMelklBT5K: veeamconfig schedule set --jobName $activity.definition_activity_01FD9GQE5X2SN3JcXG72nQnMPCPFHiDKBVA.output.jsonpath_queries.backup job name$ --weekdays $activity.definition_activity_01FD9GQE5X2SN3JcXG72nQnMPCPFHiDKBVA.output.jsonpath_queries.backup schedule$ --at $activity.definition_activity_01FD9GQE5X2SN3JcXG72nQnMPCPFHiDKBVA.output.jsonpath_queries.backup schedule time$

properties.description: Used to get input from Workload manager
Check if the backup is going to be managed from the VAC or if it is going to happen in unmanaged mode.
If backup policy is different from null, switch to managed mode
